alert.note: Alert for Central Washington; Coastal Washington; Northern Washington (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 13 at 7:05PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Washington County through 745 PM EDT... At 704 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Grand Lake Stream to 7 miles west of Meddybemps to 7 miles northeast of Deblois. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Calais, Perry, Pembroke, Princeton, Meddybemps, Grand Lake Stream, Deblois, Fowler Township, Dyer Township, Centerville, Baileyville, East Machias, Robbinston, Marshfield, Alexander, Dennysville, Charlotte, Baring, Whitneyville and Cooper. This includes the following highways... US Highway 1 between Dennysville and Pembroke, and between Princeton and Waite. State Highway 9 between Wesley and Baring. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central Washington; Coastal Washington; Northern Washington
